title.native: 戦闘妖精少女 たすけて！メイヴちゃん
title.english: Fighting Fairy Girl Rescue Me: Mave-chan

description:
Rei goes to an anime convention and ends up in a world created by the desires of anime fans. Rei doesn't know how to get back and the world starts to collapse because the convention is coming to a close.

(Source: AniDB)
synonyms: Fighting Fantasy Girl Rescue Me: Mave-chan

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/森山雄治) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuji_Moriyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/77356964)

Yuuji Moriyama is a director, animator and character designer.

Moriyama started helping out with in-between animation when he was a student at Kanto Daiichi High School. After graduating from high school, he joined Studio Musashi, which was recruiting staff through newspaper ads. His first work as an official in-betweener was for [Wakusei Robo Danguard Ace](https://anilist.co/anime/1986/). He then moved to Studio Cockpit, where he worked on [Galaxy Express 999](https://anilist.co/anime/1491/), before moving on to NeoMedia. There he worked on [Trider G7](https://anilist.co/anime/4536/), [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/), and [Belle and Sebastian](https://anilist.co/anime/3836/). With Trider G7, he was promoted from in-between to key animation. He left NeoMedia in 1982 to work as a freelancer, starting with [Combat Mecha Xabungle](https://anilist.co/anime/2254/) and [Makyou Densetsu Acrobunch](https://anilist.co/anime/3880/).

The popular anime [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/), in which he participated from the same year, was Moriyama's breakthrough work. With this series, he made his debut as an animation director and storyboard artist, and was in charge of the opening animation for the first time, joining a group of popular animators overnight. Chief director [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/), who was responsible for Urusei Yatsura, expected him to become a partner, so Moriyama tried his hand at manga as well by illustrating a manga written by Oshii that was serialized in the Animage magazine in 1984 called Todo no Tsumari. After the end of Urusei Yatsura, he was selected as a character designer for the later series [Maison Ikkoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1453/), and has since been in charge of character design for many other works. In 1987, he won the 4th Japan Anime Awards in the Animation Director category. After that, he shifted from animating to directing.
After that he participated in many works, mainly Chaos Project , Studio Pierrot , and Studio Hibari and then has seated at Studio Hibari's Lerche. 

Moriyama often works under one of his many pen-names.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikuto_yamashita?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor)

Yamashita Ikuto is a Japanese male mangaka and designer. He was born in the Gifu Prefecture, Japan and is a graduate of the Nagoya University Of Arts.

His representative work in manga is Dark Whisper (serialised in Dengeki Daioh). In the field of anime, he is the mecha designer in the Neon Genesis Evangelion series and Sentou Yousei Yukikaze. The designs for Yukikaze were originally drawn as recreation as well as Sentou Yousei Shoujo Tasukete! Mave-chan.

Besides Evangelion, he has also done mecha designs for other Gainax works including Gunbuster and Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water and was also the mechanical designer for Blue Submarine 6.

(Source: AniDB)

**Robert Buchholz** is an American producer, voice actor, script/screenwriter, story editor, and voice director. He has produced voices for anime and video games. Robert is the owner of Spliced Bread Productions.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/森山雄治) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuji_Moriyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/77356964)

Yuuji Moriyama is a director, animator and character designer.

Moriyama started helping out with in-between animation when he was a student at Kanto Daiichi High School. After graduating from high school, he joined Studio Musashi, which was recruiting staff through newspaper ads. His first work as an official in-betweener was for [Wakusei Robo Danguard Ace](https://anilist.co/anime/1986/). He then moved to Studio Cockpit, where he worked on [Galaxy Express 999](https://anilist.co/anime/1491/), before moving on to NeoMedia. With Trider G7, he was promoted from in-between to key animation. He left NeoMedia in 1982 to work as a freelancer, starting with [Combat Mecha Xabungle](https://anilist.co/anime/2254/) and [Makyou Densetsu Acrobunch](https://anilist.co/anime/3880/).

The popular anime [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/), in which he participated from the same year, was Moriyama's breakthrough work. With this series, he made his debut as an animation director and storyboard artist, and was in charge of the opening animation for the first time, joining a group of popular animators overnight. Chief director [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/), who was responsible for Urusei Yatsura, expected him to become a partner, so Moriyama tried his hand at manga as well by illustrating a manga written by Oshii that was serialized in the Animage magazine in 1984 called Todo no Tsumari. After the end of Urusei Yatsura, he was selected as a character designer for the later series [Maison Ikkoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1453/), and has since been in charge of character design for many other works. In 1987, he won the 4th Japan Anime Awards in the Animation Director category. After that, he shifted from animating to directing.
After that he participated in many works, mainly Chaos Project , Studio Pierrot , and Studio Hibari and then has seated at Studio Hibari's Lerche. 

Moriyama often works under one of his many pen-names.

**Robert Buchholz** is an American producer, voice actor, script/screenwriter, story editor, and voice director. He has produced voices for anime and video games. Robert is the owner of Spliced Bread Productions.

__Nicknames:__ かおりん(Kaorin), 香里ちゃん(Kaori-chan)
__Height: __ 152 cm
__Hobbies:__ Sports, swimming, singing
__Agency:__ Freelance

[Website](https://kaorijinal.com) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/shimizu-kaori) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ShimizuKaori)

A voice actress, narrator, actress and former child actor. She debuted her voice acting carrier in 1998, voicing the character [Iwakura Lain](https://anilist.co/character/2219/Iwakura-Lain) from [serial experiments lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/serial-experiments-lain/).
She used to belong to Three Tree agency but is now a freelancer.

[Profile](https://haikyo.co.jp/profile/profile.php?ActorID=11570) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/readingradio)

Her younger brother [Takashi Oohara](https://anilist.co/staff/96636/) is also a voice actor.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Harran - Goddess of Victory - Nikke (VG)
- Ningguang - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Mikasa - Azur Lane (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fantasia_iizuka)

Tomohisa Iizuka is a producer and planner for anime. He served as the representative director of Studio Fantasia until it went bankrupt in 2016. Before that he worked in the finishing section of Tsuchida Production as colour designer.

Iizuka founded the animation company Studio Fantasia, when he was still an employee of Tsuchida Production, on October 12, 1983 which was three years before Tsuchida Production collapsed into bankruptcy.

__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/moritakeshi)

Son of the baseball player Tooru Mori.

Kawashiro Kazumi is the president & CEO of Bandai Visual. He graduated from Sophia University - a private university in Japan famous for its international climate. In April of 1982, a month after graduation, he started working at Canyon Records. In July of 1989 he joined Bandai and in April of 1994 he was transferred to Bandai Visual of which he became the president of in May of 2003. In 2010, he was succeeded by Ooshita Satoshi, although Kawashiro remained in the company as the vice-president. In April 2012, he was again appointed the president of Bandai Visual.

(Source: AniDB)
Co-founder of Anime R together with [Moriyasu Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/106638/). Founder of Studio Muu.
